fullText: Though Lincoln Center Theater's production of 'McNeal' offers Lincoln as a magnetic presence, the play itself feels more like a demonstration than a drama.
dtliExcerpt: Though Lincoln Center Theater's production of 'McNeal' offers Lincoln as a magnetic presence, the play itself feels more like a demonstration than a drama.
bwwExcerpt: Iâ€™m afraid, alas, the pixel wins, because the play, which opened on Monday, in a stylish Lincoln Center Theater production directed by Bartlett Sher, works only as provocation. Timely but turgid, it rarely rises to drama; in a neat recapitulation of current fears about technology, its humans, hardly credible as such, have been almost entirely replaced by ideas.
